snippet: Thea Westreich Wagner and her husband, Ethan Wagner, plan to give more than 800 works of contemporary art to the Whitney Museum in New York and the Pompidou Center in Paris.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Thea Westreich Wagner and her husband Ethan Wagner promise to give more than 800 works by leading contemporary artists to the Whitney Museum of American Art and the Pompidou Center in Paris; J Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles acquires its first painting by Antoine Watteau; German artist Wolfgang Laib will create an installation made of hazelnut pollen at the Museum of Modern Art.
lead_paragraph: Thea Westreich Wagner and her husband, Ethan Wagner, plan to give more than 800 works of contemporary art to the Whitney Museum in New York and the Pompidou Center in Paris.

headline.print_headline: New York Couple’s Gift To Enrich Two Museums
headline.seo: Hundreds of Works to Go to Whitney Museum and Pompidou Center
headline.main: New York Couple’s Gift to Enrich Two Museums
